title: Family Business Governance
description: This course introduces a framework to guide private and family businesses’ long-term planning. In the course, students seek to understand how entrepreneurs and their family members provide unique assets and contributions leading to the success of the firms, and how various roadblocks challenge the sustainability of the family firm model. It can be realized that the family assets and roadblocks are similar across firms, countries and cultures, and therefore a general framework can be applied to address critical governance decisions including family governance, ownership structures, executive compensation and promotion, and succession and exit, with the aim of improving the well-being of both the firms and the families behind them.
outcome: This course focuses on institutional environments in Asia and the greater China, yet adopting a global comparative approach. Students will learn to use economic analysis to solve critical family firm governance problems and help their long-term goals and sustainability.
recommended_readings: 范博宏，《交托之重》，東方出版社 (Beijing, Published in 2014) Joseph P.H. Fan & Morten BENNEDSEN, The Family Business Map, Palgrave Macmillan (New York, 2014)

title: Management of the Corporation
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: This course is the prerequisite of all EMBA courses. It provides a business and management view of the modern corporation. The management aspect of the course considers the changing competitive world, the role of corporations in world development, the values of top management, and the vision needed to plan, organize, lead, and control corporate activities. The business aspect of the course integrates the business functions of the corporation such as marketing, finance, human resources, and production in order to accomplish the corporation's goals.
outcome: Individual 1. Obtain better understanding about oneself. 2. Understand the importance of balancing oneself, family and work. 3. Learn about the “Art of success and happiness”.  Team 1. Strengthen the team communication and relationship. 2. Learn how to achieve better result and become more productive.  Corporation 1. Understand the importance of accountability for all managers to create value for all stakeholders. 2. Know how to coordinate strategy and execution to ensure success. 3. Learn how to lead with cross-functional perspectives. 4. Obtain experience on how to create success through team coordination in analysis and decision-making in a highly ambiguous, uncertain and competitive marketplace.  Society 1. Understand how to maximize oneself social contribution and the process of defining this. 2. Understand social contribution model, and develop a corporate social integration strategy.

title: Seminar on Business and Management Issues
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: This course addresses the latest development in the fields of business and management. Some relevant topics such as electronic business, leadership, corporate governance, social and cultural issues, entrepreneurship, start-ups and IPOs, cross cultural business management, etc. would be incorporated in this seminar course.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to understand in depth a wide spectrum of business and management issues and to be able to apply what they have learnt in their daily management and business practices in the future.

title: Selected Topics in Business and Management
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: This course aims to expose our students to a wide spectrum of global, regional and local business and management issues. To facilitate effective learning, specific topics will be selected for incorporating in this course: examples include trade, economics, technology, finance, market, ventures, politics, corporate governance, management practices, as well as various societal concerns. Throughout this course, lectures, talks, and site visits, in the local and/or international arena, will be conducted to enable students to identify in-depth the gist behind certain selected management and business topics and to come up with insights to help corporations make better decisions in the future. This course consists of an introductory review, followed by an intensive study week in the local and/or international arena. Students have to report their learning and insights with other students after the study week.
outcome: This course aims to expose our students to a wide spectrum of global, regional and local business and management issues. To facilitate effective learning, specific topics will be selected for incorporating in this course: examples include trade, economics, technology, finance, market, ventures, politics, corporate governance, management practices, as well as various societal concerns.

title: Contemporary Perspectives of Effective Management
description: This course covers the contemporary special topics in management. Depending on the needs and demands in a particular year, the instructor may select to examine in depth on one of the following topics such as: corporate governance in modern management, executive coaching for leadership effectiveness, consultancy in the modern management and management in the Chinese culture and other contemporary special topics.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to understand in depth a wide spectrum of contemporary management issues and to be able to apply effectively what they have learnt to their daily management practices.

title: Current Practices for Business Success
description: This course addresses the latest practices in the business arena, with the objective of bringing the current practices and execution in the competitive business world. Depending on the needs and demands in a particular year, the instructor may select to examine in depth on one of the following topics such as: social enterprises, doing business in China, business conflict resolution, application of big data in the contemporary chaotic business environment, global supply chain management and other selected topics.
outcome: Upon completion of the course, students are expected to be able to recognize various determinants of business success. Emphasis is also placed on making students being able to apply what they have acquired in the lectures and projects as far as questing for business excellence is concerned.

title: Global Business and Management Field Study
requirements: For students in EMBA; or EMBA (Chinese)
description: This course consists of preparatory assignments and a written study plan, followed by a five-day study week in a selected place outside Hong Kong. Students have to submit a written report and make oral presentation of their work. The goal in taking classroom sessions abroad is to expose our students to a wide spectrum of issues related to global business and management. Students will be exposed to different national environments, advantages and problems associated with various forms of international operations, and management strategies of international firms.
outcome: The objectives of the course are, through the design, organization and implementation of a field study outside Hong Kong, to enable the students to: - acquire awareness of, and an appreciation for, the diversity and complexity of the international business environment;  - understand the role of analysis of macro dimensions (cultural, demographic, economic, educational, environmental, legal, political, sociological and technological) in making global business decisions;  - review contemporary and relevant developments in the global or regional arena, and to explore the possible strategic alternatives to capitalize on changes in the global scenario; - apply business/ management concepts and skills acquired during the EMBA program in a real-life global business context; and - generate insightful and concrete business plans based on the research findings of the field study.
